com.digi.xbee.api

Class ZigBeeDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.digi.xbee.api.AbstractXBeeDevice
      • com.digi.xbee.api.XBeeDevice
        • com.digi.xbee.api.ZigBeeDevice

  • public class ZigBeeDevice
extends XBeeDevice
    This class represents a local ZigBee device.
    See Also:
    XBeeDevice, DigiMeshDevice, DigiPointDevice, Raw802Device

      • ZigBeeDevice

        public ZigBeeDevice(IConnectionInterface connectionInterface)
        Class constructor. Instantiates a new ZigBeeDevice object with the given connection interface.
        Parameters:
        connectionInterface - The connection interface with the physical ZigBee device.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if connectionInterface == null
        See Also:
        IConnectionInterface

      • ZigBeeDevice

        public ZigBeeDevice(String port,
            int baudRate)
        Class constructor. Instantiates a new ZigBeeDevice object in the given port name and baud rate.
        Parameters:
        port - Serial port name where ZigBee device is attached to.
        baudRate - Serial port baud rate to communicate with the device. Other connection parameters will be set as default (8 data bits, 1 stop bit, no parity, no flow control).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if baudRate < 0.
        NullPointerException - if port == null.

      • ZigBeeDevice

        public ZigBeeDevice(String port,
            int baudRate,
            int dataBits,
            int stopBits,
            int parity,
            int flowControl)
        Class constructor. Instantiates a new ZigBeeDevice object in the given serial port name and settings.
        Parameters:
        port - Serial port name where ZigBee device is attached to.
        baudRate - Serial port baud rate to communicate with the device.
        dataBits - Serial port data bits.
        stopBits - Serial port data bits.
        parity - Serial port data bits.
        flowControl - Serial port data bits.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if baudRate < 0 or if dataBits < 0 or if stopBits < 0 or if parity < 0 or if flowControl < 0.
        NullPointerException - if port == null.

        public ZigBeeDevice(String port,
            SerialPortParameters serialPortParameters)
        Class constructor. Instantiates a new ZigBeeDevice object in the given serial port name and parameters.
        Parameters:
        port - Serial port name where ZigBee device is attached to.
        serialPortParameters - Object containing the serial port parameters.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if port == null or if serialPortParameters == null.

    • Method Detail

      • addExplicitDataListener

        public void addExplicitDataListener(IExplicitDataReceiveListener listener)
        Description copied from class: AbstractXBeeDevice
        Adds the provided listener to the list of listeners to be notified when new explicit data packets are received.

        If the listener has been already included this method does nothing.

        Parameters:
        listener - Listener to be notified when new explicit data packets are received.
        See Also:
        AbstractXBeeDevice.removeExplicitDataListener(IExplicitDataReceiveListener), IExplicitDataReceiveListener

      • forceDisassociate

        public void forceDisassociate()
                       throws TimeoutException,
                              XBeeException
        Description copied from class: AbstractXBeeDevice
        Forces this XBee device to immediately disassociate from the network and re-attempt to associate.

        Only valid for End Devices.

        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if there is a timeout executing the disassociation command.
        XBeeException - if there is any other XBee related exception.
        See Also:
        AbstractXBeeDevice.getAssociationIndicationStatus()

      • getAPIOutputMode

        public APIOutputMode getAPIOutputMode()
                               throws TimeoutException,
                                      XBeeException
        Description copied from class: XBeeDevice
        Returns the API output mode of the XBee device.

        The API output mode determines the format that the received data is output through the serial interface of the XBee device.

        Returns:
        The API output mode that the XBee device is configured with.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if there is a timeout getting the API output mode from the device.
        XBeeException - if there is any other XBee related exception.
        See Also:
        XBeeDevice.setAPIOutputMode(APIOutputMode), APIOutputMode

      • getAssociationIndicationStatus

        public AssociationIndicationStatus getAssociationIndicationStatus()
                                                           throws TimeoutException,
                                                                  XBeeException
        Description copied from class: AbstractXBeeDevice
        Returns the current association status of this XBee device.

        It indicates occurrences of errors during the last association request.

        Returns:
        The association indication status of the XBee device.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if there is a timeout getting the association indication status.
        XBeeException - if there is any other XBee related exception.
        See Also:
        AbstractXBeeDevice.forceDisassociate(), AssociationIndicationStatus

      • getXBeeProtocol

        public XBeeProtocol getXBeeProtocol()
        Description copied from class: AbstractXBeeDevice
        Returns the XBee Protocol of this XBee device.

        To refresh this value use the AbstractXBeeDevice.readDeviceInfo() method.

        Overrides:
        getXBeeProtocol in class AbstractXBeeDevice
        Returns:
        The XBee device protocol.
        See Also:

      • open

        public void open()
          throws XBeeException
        Description copied from class: XBeeDevice
        Opens the connection interface associated with this XBee device.

        When opening the device an information reading process is automatically performed. This includes:

        • 64-bit address.
        • Node Identifier.
        • Hardware version.
        • Firmware version.
        • XBee device protocol.
        • 16-bit address (not for DigiMesh modules).
        Overrides:
        open in class XBeeDevice
        Throws:
        XBeeException - if there is any problem opening this device connection.
        See Also:
        XBeeDevice.close(), XBeeDevice.isOpen()

      • readExplicitData

        public ExplicitXBeeMessage readExplicitData()
        Description copied from class: XBeeDevice
        Reads new explicit data received by this XBee device during the configured receive timeout.

        This method blocks until new explicit data is received or the configured receive timeout expires.

        The receive timeout is configured using the setReceiveTimeout method and can be consulted with getReceiveTimeout method.

        For non-blocking operations, register a IExplicitDataReceiveListener using the method AbstractXBeeDevice.addExplicitDataListener(IExplicitDataReceiveListener).

        Returns:
        An ExplicitXBeeMessage object containing the explicit data, the source address of the remote node that sent the data and other values related to the transmission. null if this did not receive new explicit data during the configured receive timeout.
        See Also:
        XBeeDevice.getReceiveTimeout(), XBeeDevice.readExplicitData(int), XBeeDevice.readExplicitDataFrom(RemoteXBeeDevice), XBeeDevice.readExplicitDataFrom(RemoteXBeeDevice, int), XBeeDevice.setReceiveTimeout(int), ExplicitXBeeMessage

      • readExplicitData

        public ExplicitXBeeMessage readExplicitData(int timeout)
        Description copied from class: XBeeDevice
        Reads new explicit data received by this XBee device during the provided timeout.

        This method blocks until new explicit data is received or the provided timeout expires.

        For non-blocking operations, register a IExplicitDataReceiveListener using the method AbstractXBeeDevice.addExplicitDataListener(IExplicitDataReceiveListener).

        Parameters:
        timeout - The time to wait for new explicit data in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        An ExplicitXBeeMessage object containing the explicit data, the source address of the remote node that sent the data and other values related to the transmission. null if this device did not receive new explicit data during timeout milliseconds.
        See Also:
        XBeeDevice.readExplicitData(), XBeeDevice.readExplicitDataFrom(RemoteXBeeDevice), XBeeDevice.readExplicitDataFrom(RemoteXBeeDevice, int), ExplicitXBeeMessage

      • readExplicitDataFrom

        public ExplicitXBeeMessage readExplicitDataFrom(RemoteXBeeDevice remoteXBeeDevice)
        Description copied from class: XBeeDevice
        Reads new explicit data received from the given remote XBee device during the configured receive timeout.

        This method blocks until new explicit data from the provided remote XBee device is received or the configured receive timeout expires.

        The receive timeout is configured using the setReceiveTimeout method and can be consulted with getReceiveTimeout method.

        For non-blocking operations, register a IExplicitDataReceiveListener using the method AbstractXBeeDevice.addExplicitDataListener(IExplicitDataReceiveListener).

        Parameters:
        remoteXBeeDevice - The remote device to read explicit data from.
        Returns:
        An ExplicitXBeeMessage object containing the explicit data, the source address of the remote node that sent the data and other values related to the transmission. null if this device did not receive new explicit data from the provided remote XBee device during the configured receive timeout.
        See Also:
        XBeeDevice.getReceiveTimeout(), XBeeDevice.readExplicitData(), XBeeDevice.readExplicitData(int), XBeeDevice.readExplicitDataFrom(RemoteXBeeDevice, int), XBeeDevice.setReceiveTimeout(int), RemoteXBeeDevice, ExplicitXBeeMessage

      • readExplicitDataFrom

        public ExplicitXBeeMessage readExplicitDataFrom(RemoteXBeeDevice remoteXBeeDevice,
                                       int timeout)
        Description copied from class: XBeeDevice
        Reads new explicit data received from the given remote XBee device during the provided timeout.

        This method blocks until new explicit data from the provided remote XBee device is received or the given timeout expires.

        For non-blocking operations, register a IExplicitDataReceiveListener using the method AbstractXBeeDevice.addExplicitDataListener(IExplicitDataReceiveListener).

        Parameters:
        remoteXBeeDevice - The remote device to read explicit data from.
        timeout - The time to wait for new explicit data in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        An ExplicitXBeeMessage object containing the explicit data, the source address of the remote node that sent the data and other values related to the transmission. null if this device did not receive new data from the provided remote XBee device during timeout milliseconds.
        See Also:
        XBeeDevice.getReceiveTimeout(), XBeeDevice.readExplicitData(), XBeeDevice.readExplicitData(int), XBeeDevice.readExplicitDataFrom(RemoteXBeeDevice), XBeeDevice.setReceiveTimeout(int), RemoteXBeeDevice, ExplicitXBeeMessage

      • removeExplicitDataListener

        public void removeExplicitDataListener(IExplicitDataReceiveListener listener)
        Description copied from class: AbstractXBeeDevice
        Removes the provided listener from the list of explicit data receive listeners.

        If the listener was not in the list this method does nothing.

        Parameters:
        listener - Listener to be removed from the list of listeners.
        See Also:
        AbstractXBeeDevice.addExplicitDataListener(IExplicitDataReceiveListener), IExplicitDataReceiveListener

      • sendBroadcastExplicitData

        public void sendBroadcastExplicitData(int sourceEndpoint,
                             int destEndpoint,
                             int clusterID,
                             int profileID,
                             byte[] data)
                               throws TimeoutException,
                                      XBeeException
        Description copied from class: XBeeDevice
        Sends the provided data to all the XBee nodes of the network (broadcast) in application layer mode. Application layer mode means that you need to specify the application layer fields to be sent with the data.

        This method blocks till a success or error transmit status arrives or the configured receive timeout expires.

        The receive timeout is configured using the setReceiveTimeout method and can be consulted with getReceiveTimeout method.

        Parameters:
        sourceEndpoint - Source endpoint for the transmission.
        destEndpoint - Destination endpoint for the transmission.
        clusterID - Cluster ID used in the transmission.
        profileID - Profile ID used in the transmission.
        data - Byte array containing the data to be sent.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if there is a timeout sending the data.
        XBeeException - if there is any other XBee related exception.
        See Also:
        XBeeDevice.getReceiveTimeout(), XBeeDevice.setReceiveTimeout(int)

      • sendData

        public void sendData(XBee64BitAddress address64Bit,
            XBee16BitAddress address16bit,
            byte[] data)
              throws TimeoutException,
                     XBeeException
        Description copied from class: XBeeDevice
        Sends the provided data to the XBee device of the network corresponding to the given 64-bit/16-bit address.

        This method blocks till a success or error response arrives or the configured receive timeout expires.

        The receive timeout is configured using the setReceiveTimeout method and can be consulted with getReceiveTimeout method.

        For non-blocking operations use the method XBeeDevice.sendDataAsync(XBee64BitAddress, XBee16BitAddress, byte[]).

        Parameters:
        address64Bit - The 64-bit address of the XBee that will receive the data.
        address16bit - The 16-bit address of the XBee that will receive the data. If it is unknown the XBee16BitAddress.UNKNOWN_ADDRESS must be used.
        data - Byte array containing the data to be sent.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if there is a timeout sending the data.
        XBeeException - if a remote device is trying to send data or if there is any other XBee related exception.
        See Also:
        XBeeDevice.getReceiveTimeout(), XBeeDevice.setReceiveTimeout(int), XBeeDevice.sendData(RemoteXBeeDevice, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendData(XBee64BitAddress, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendDataAsync(RemoteXBeeDevice, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendDataAsync(XBee64BitAddress, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendDataAsync(XBee64BitAddress, XBee16BitAddress, byte[]), XBee16BitAddress, XBee64BitAddress

      • sendDataAsync

        public void sendDataAsync(XBee64BitAddress address64Bit,
                 XBee16BitAddress address16bit,
                 byte[] data)
                   throws XBeeException
        Description copied from class: XBeeDevice
        Sends asynchronously the provided data to the XBee device of the network corresponding to the given 64-bit/16-bit address.

        Asynchronous transmissions do not wait for answer from the remote device or for transmit status packet.

        Parameters:
        address64Bit - The 64-bit address of the XBee that will receive the data.
        address16bit - The 16-bit address of the XBee that will receive the data. If it is unknown the XBee16BitAddress.UNKNOWN_ADDRESS must be used.
        data - Byte array containing the data to be sent.
        Throws:
        XBeeException - if a remote device is trying to send data or if there is any other XBee related exception.
        See Also:
        XBeeDevice.sendData(RemoteXBeeDevice, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendData(XBee64BitAddress, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendData(XBee64BitAddress, XBee16BitAddress, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendDataAsync(RemoteXBeeDevice, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendDataAsync(XBee64BitAddress, byte[]), XBee16BitAddress, XBee64BitAddress

      • sendExplicitData

        public void sendExplicitData(RemoteXBeeDevice remoteXBeeDevice,
                    int sourceEndpoint,
                    int destEndpoint,
                    int clusterID,
                    int profileID,
                    byte[] data)
                      throws TimeoutException,
                             XBeeException
        Description copied from class: XBeeDevice
        Sends the provided data to the given XBee device in application layer mode choosing the optimal send method depending on the protocol of the local XBee device. Application layer mode means that you need to specify the application layer fields to be sent with the data.

        This method blocks till a success or error response arrives or the configured receive timeout expires.

        The receive timeout is configured using the setReceiveTimeout method and can be consulted with getReceiveTimeout method.

        Parameters:
        remoteXBeeDevice - The XBee device of the network that will receive the explicit data.
        sourceEndpoint - Source endpoint for the transmission.
        destEndpoint - Destination endpoint for the transmission.
        clusterID - Cluster ID used in the transmission.
        profileID - Profile ID used in the transmission.
        data - Byte array containing the data to be sent.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if there is a timeout sending the data.
        XBeeException - if there is any other XBee related exception.
        See Also:
        XBeeDevice.getReceiveTimeout(), XBeeDevice.sendExplicitData(XBee64BitAddress, int, int, int, int, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendExplicitData(XBee64BitAddress, XBee16BitAddress, int, int, int, int, byte[]), XBeeDevice.setReceiveTimeout(int), RemoteXBeeDevice

      • sendExplicitData

        public void sendExplicitData(XBee64BitAddress address64Bit,
                    XBee16BitAddress address16bit,
                    int sourceEndpoint,
                    int destEndpoint,
                    int clusterID,
                    int profileID,
                    byte[] data)
                      throws TimeoutException,
                             XBeeException
        Description copied from class: XBeeDevice
        Sends the provided data in application layer mode to the XBee device of the network corresponding to the given 64-bit/16-bit address. Application layer mode means that you need to specify the application layer fields to be sent with the data.

        This method blocks till a success or error response arrives or the configured receive timeout expires.

        The receive timeout is configured using the setReceiveTimeout method and can be consulted with getReceiveTimeout method.

        Parameters:
        address64Bit - The 64-bit address of the XBee that will receive the data.
        address16bit - The 16-bit address of the XBee that will receive the data. If it is unknown the XBee16BitAddress.UNKNOWN_ADDRESS must be used.
        sourceEndpoint - Source endpoint for the transmission.
        destEndpoint - Destination endpoint for the transmission.
        clusterID - Cluster ID used in the transmission.
        profileID - Profile ID used in the transmission.
        data - Byte array containing the data to be sent.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if there is a timeout sending the data.
        XBeeException - if there is any other XBee related exception.
        See Also:
        XBeeDevice.getReceiveTimeout(), XBeeDevice.sendExplicitData(RemoteXBeeDevice, int, int, int, int, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendExplicitData(XBee64BitAddress, int, int, int, int, byte[]), XBeeDevice.setReceiveTimeout(int), XBee16BitAddress, XBee64BitAddress

      • sendExplicitDataAsync

        public void sendExplicitDataAsync(RemoteXBeeDevice xbeeDevice,
                         int sourceEndpoint,
                         int destEndpoint,
                         int clusterID,
                         int profileID,
                         byte[] data)
                           throws XBeeException
        Description copied from class: XBeeDevice
        Sends asynchronously the provided data in application layer mode to the provided XBee device choosing the optimal send method depending on the protocol of the local XBee device. Application layer mode means that you need to specify the application layer fields to be sent with the data.

        Asynchronous transmissions do not wait for answer from the remote device or for transmit status packet.

        Parameters:
        xbeeDevice - The XBee device of the network that will receive the data.
        sourceEndpoint - Source endpoint for the transmission.
        destEndpoint - Destination endpoint for the transmission.
        clusterID - Cluster ID used in the transmission.
        profileID - Profile ID used in the transmission.
        data - Byte array containing the data to be sent.
        Throws:
        XBeeException - if there is any other XBee related exception.
        See Also:
        XBeeDevice.sendExplicitData(RemoteXBeeDevice, int, int, int, int, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendExplicitData(XBee64BitAddress, int, int, int, int, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendExplicitData(XBee64BitAddress, XBee16BitAddress, int, int, int, int, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendExplicitDataAsync(XBee64BitAddress, int, int, int, int, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendExplicitDataAsync(XBee64BitAddress, XBee16BitAddress, int, int, int, int, byte[]), RemoteXBeeDevice

      • sendExplicitDataAsync

        public void sendExplicitDataAsync(XBee64BitAddress address64Bit,
                         XBee16BitAddress address16Bit,
                         int sourceEndpoint,
                         int destEndpoint,
                         int clusterID,
                         int profileID,
                         byte[] data)
                           throws XBeeException
        Description copied from class: XBeeDevice
        Sends asynchronously the provided data in application layer mode to the XBee device of the network corresponding to the given 64-bit/16-bit address. Application layer mode means that you need to specify the application layer fields to be sent with the data.

        Asynchronous transmissions do not wait for answer from the remote device or for transmit status packet.

        Parameters:
        address64Bit - The 64-bit address of the XBee that will receive the data.
        address16Bit - The 16-bit address of the XBee that will receive the data. If it is unknown the XBee16BitAddress.UNKNOWN_ADDRESS must be used.
        sourceEndpoint - Source endpoint for the transmission.
        destEndpoint - Destination endpoint for the transmission.
        clusterID - Cluster ID used in the transmission.
        profileID - Profile ID used in the transmission.
        data - Byte array containing the data to be sent.
        Throws:
        XBeeException - if there is any other XBee related exception.
        See Also:
        XBeeDevice.sendExplicitData(RemoteXBeeDevice, int, int, int, int, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendExplicitData(XBee64BitAddress, int, int, int, int, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendExplicitData(XBee64BitAddress, XBee16BitAddress, int, int, int, int, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendExplicitDataAsync(RemoteXBeeDevice, int, int, int, int, byte[]), XBeeDevice.sendExplicitDataAsync(XBee64BitAddress, int, int, int, int, byte[]), XBee16BitAddress, XBee64BitAddress

      • sendMulticastData

        public void sendMulticastData(XBee16BitAddress groupID,
                     int sourceEndpoint,
                     int destEndpoint,
                     int clusterID,
                     int profileID,
                     byte[] data)
                       throws XBeeException
        Sends a multicast transmission with the provided data to the given group ID.

        This method blocks till a success or error response arrives or the configured receive timeout expires.

        The receive timeout is configured using the setReceiveTimeout method and can be consulted with getReceiveTimeout method.

        Parameters:
        groupID - 16-bit address of the destination group ID.
        sourceEndpoint - Source endpoint for the transmission.
        destEndpoint - Destination endpoint for the transmission.
        clusterID - Cluster ID used in the transmission.
        profileID - Profile ID used in the transmission.
        data - Byte array containing the data to be sent.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if sourceEndpoint < 0 or if sourceEndpoint > 0xFF or if destEndpoint < 0 or if destEndpoint > 0xFF or if clusterID < 0 or if clusterID > 0xFFFF or if profileID < 0 or if profileID > 0xFFFF.
        InterfaceNotOpenException - if this device connection is not open.
        NullPointerException - if groupID == null or if data == null.
        TimeoutException - if there is a timeout sending the data.
        XBeeException - if there is any other XBee related exception.
        See Also:
        sendMulticastDataAsync(XBee16BitAddress, int, int, int, int, byte[]), XBeeDevice.getReceiveTimeout(), XBeeDevice.setReceiveTimeout(int), XBee16BitAddress

      • sendMulticastDataAsync

        public void sendMulticastDataAsync(XBee16BitAddress groupID,
                          int sourceEndpoint,
                          int destEndpoint,
                          int clusterID,
                          int profileID,
                          byte[] data)
                            throws XBeeException
        Sends a multicast asynchronous transmission with the provided data to the given group ID.

        Asynchronous transmissions do not wait for answer from the remote device or for transmit status packet.

        Parameters:
        groupID - 16-bit address of the destination group ID.
        sourceEndpoint - Source endpoint for the transmission.
        destEndpoint - Destination endpoint for the transmission.
        clusterID - Cluster ID used in the transmission.
        profileID - Profile ID used in the transmission.
        data - Byte array containing the data to be sent.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if sourceEndpoint < 0 or if sourceEndpoint > 0xFF or if destEndpoint < 0 or if destEndpoint > 0xFF or if clusterID < 0 or if clusterID > 0xFFFF or if profileID < 0 or if profileID > 0xFFFF.
        InterfaceNotOpenException - if this device connection is not open.
        NullPointerException - if groupID == null or if data == null.
        XBeeException - if there is any other XBee related exception.
        See Also:
        sendMulticastData(XBee16BitAddress, int, int, int, int, byte[]), XBee64BitAddress

      • setAPIOutputMode

        public void setAPIOutputMode(APIOutputMode apiOutputMode)
                      throws TimeoutException,
                             XBeeException
        Description copied from class: XBeeDevice
        Configures the API output mode of the XBee device.

        The API output mode determines the format that the received data is output through the serial interface of the XBee device.

        Parameters:
        apiOutputMode - The API output mode to be set to the XBee device.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if there is a timeout configuring the API output mode.
        XBeeException - if there is any other XBee related exception.
        See Also:
        XBeeDevice.getAPIOutputMode(), APIOutputMode
